entry.value: Metanode for the protein sequence coverage calculation.%%00010%%00010Two input tables are needed, the top table should contain sequences where the sequence coverage is to be calculated using the sequences provided from the bottom table.%%00010%%00010Sequence coverage is calculated using all sequences provided in the bottom table, sequence identificators are not used at the moment.%%00010%%00010Standard FASTA sequence format using single letter amino acid codes is supported with the following exceptions:%%00010B: treated as either D or N in both input tables%%00010J: treated as either I or L in both input tables%%00010Z: treated as either E or Q in both input tables%%00010X: treated as any letter in both input tables%%00010%%00010Translation stop ("*") and gap ("-") signs are not treated in any way so unless they would be present in both sequences sources, the sequences would not match.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010Used programs and tools and their respective licenses at the time of the metanode creation. Version numbers and the licenses might differ based on your local installation. Please inspect your local installation and contact us if you can not locate your local version and or license terms.%%00010%%00010KNIME nodes (The KNIME nodes consists of the following GNU GPL 3.0 License. Licence terms are available here: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html)%%00010Python 3 (The Python consists of the following Python 3.10 License. Licence terms are available here: https://docs.python.org/3.10/license.html)%%00010%%00010The metanode was created in KNIME 4.7.7 running inside the docker image (https://hub.docker.com/r/cfprot/knime/), tag 4.7.7a.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010This version of metanode is available under the GNU GPL 3.0 License, unless stated otherwise. The full version of the license terms is available at https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html.%%00010Version: 0.1.0 from 2024-06-21%%00010Contact person: David Potesil (david.potesil@ceitec.muni.cz)%%00010More information can be found at https://github.com/OmicsWorkflows/KNIME_metanodes.
input table containing aminoacid sequences where the seqeuence coverage is to be calculated
table with aminoacid sequences to be used to calculate sequence coverage of the aminoacid sequenced provided in the upper table
input table 1 supplemented by looked up columns; not used columns does not have to be retained if specified
